title: 0.3 release checklist
body_html:
• backport some of the recent master commits
    • some of them were marked 0.3 release blockers, went into master
  • finish 0.3 blockers
  • port over linker version script to the 0.3 branch
  • add linker version script for TH, THNN, THC, THCUNN, THD (right now only _C is covered and that's not enough).
  • install devtoolset3 inside the conda docker too (anaconda now moved over to gcc 7.xx which is not CUDA compatible
    • adjust meta.yaml files to remove libgcc and gcc entries
  • fix the numpy version to be used when building binaries (See #2564)
    • change conda meta.yaml
    • change the manylinux shell script recipe
  • (maybe) build static fPIC openmp and link against that instead (requires recompiling gcc from source)
    • this will fix the static TLS issues that people have been seeing, but it's a bit of a high-risk of being a rabbit-hole
  • change the manylinux docker image to have cudnn7 and nccl2 and cuda9
  • change the conda docker image to have cudnn7 and nccl2
  • change the hashes for patchelf commands in the manywheel build script for cudnn, nccl2 and openmp
  • add a cuda90 tracking feature for conda (similar to cuda75 and cuda80)
  • build final wheels that are manylinux1 compatible
  • build final conda packages (and stage them at -c pytorch for testing)
  • test final binaries against community repos and do basic smoke tests
  • do basic performance and memory regression testing
    • word language model
      • speed
      • memory
    • imagenet
      • speed
      • memory
    • https://github.com/pytorch/benchmark
      • speed
      • memory
  • manually test final binaries in CPU-only AWS instances
    • cuda75 wheels
    • cuda80 wheels
    • cuda90 wheels
    • cuda75 conda
    • cuda80 conda
    • cuda90 conda
  • manually test final binaries in GPU AWS instances with only NVIDIA driver installed
    • cuda75 wheels
    • cuda80 wheels
    • cuda90 wheels
    • cuda75 conda
    • cuda80 conda
    • cuda90 conda
  • Write release notes

some of them were marked 0.3 release blockers, went into master

 add linker version script for TH, THNN, THC, THCUNN, THD (right now only _C is covered and that's not enough).

 (maybe) build static fPIC openmp and link against that instead (requires recompiling gcc from source)

this will fix the static TLS issues that people have been seeing, but it's a bit of a high-risk of being a rabbit-hole


 change the manylinux docker image to have cudnn7 and nccl2 and cuda9

 build final conda packages (and stage them at -c pytorch for testing)
 test final binaries against community repos and do basic smoke tests
 do basic performance and memory regression testing

body:
- [x] backport some of the recent master commits
  - some of them were marked 0.3 release blockers, went into master
- [x] finish 0.3 blockers
- [x] port over linker version script to the 0.3 branch
- [x] add linker version script for TH, THNN, THC, THCUNN, THD (right now only _C is covered and that's not enough).
- [x] install devtoolset3 inside the conda docker too (anaconda now moved over to gcc 7.xx which is not CUDA compatible
  - [x] adjust meta.yaml files to remove libgcc and gcc entries
- [x] fix the numpy version to be used when building binaries (See https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/2564)
  - [x] change conda meta.yaml
  - [x] change the manylinux shell script recipe
- [ ] (maybe) build static fPIC openmp and link against that instead (requires recompiling gcc from source)
  - this will fix the static TLS issues that people have been seeing, but it's a bit of a high-risk of being a rabbit-hole
- [x] change the manylinux docker image to have cudnn7 and nccl2 and cuda9
- [x] change the conda docker image to have cudnn7 and nccl2
- [x] change the hashes for `patchelf` commands in the [manywheel build script](https://github.com/pytorch/builder/blob/master/manywheel/build.sh#L124) for cudnn, nccl2 and openmp
- [x] add a cuda90 tracking feature for conda (similar to cuda75 and cuda80)
- [x] build final wheels that are manylinux1 compatible
- [x] build final conda packages (and stage them at `-c pytorch` for testing)
- [x] test final binaries against [community repos](https://github.com/pytorch/builder/tree/master/test_community_repos) and do basic smoke tests
- [x] do basic performance and memory regression testing
  - word language model
    - [x] speed
    - [x] memory
  - imagenet
    - [x] speed
    - [x] memory
  - https://github.com/pytorch/benchmark
    - [ ] speed
    - [ ] memory
- [x] manually test final binaries in CPU-only AWS instances
   - cuda75 wheels
   - cuda80 wheels
   - cuda90 wheels
   - cuda75 conda
   - cuda80 conda
   - cuda90 conda
- [x] manually test final binaries in GPU AWS instances with only NVIDIA driver installed
   - cuda75 wheels
   - cuda80 wheels
   - cuda90 wheels
   - cuda75 conda
   - cuda80 conda
   - cuda90 conda
- [x] Write release notes
